This just popped up for me today: https://docs.github.com/en/repositories/working-with-files/using-files/viewing-a-file#ignore-commits-in-the-blame-view

Would be great to take advantage of that to hide things like the great rustfmt commits (such as https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/commit/95e00bfed801e264e9c4ac817004153ca0f19eb6).

I often hit https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/commit/a06baa56b95674fc626b3c3fd680d6a65357fe60

1160 files changed, 66321 insertions(+), 74703 deletions(-)
I see https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/commit/6c7d7a6bf4b8a3a653d8cba0acf5b20b088aff2e and other renames pretty frequently as well

Joshua Nelson said:

I see https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/commit/6c7d7a6bf4b8a3a653d8cba0acf5b20b088aff2e and other renames pretty frequently as well

unfortunately git-blame-ignore-revs doesn't seem to work with this because it doesn't follow renames :( it thinks the code was first created in that commit

got this working locally :) will put up a pr shortly
